pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

This is a pretty complicated proof of a simple statement, maybe there's some filter magic to improve it.

nodes.body: bors d+

:v: hrmacbeth can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Is there a corresponding `frequently` result?

> Is there a corresponding `frequently` result?

Sure, it should follow almost immediately from the `eventually` result.
I think the `frequently` result should be in this PR too, in that case
@hrmacbeth Do you mind if I take this over? I ended up needing it for Ascoli theorem.
I'm going to take this over, so I'll remove the "delegated" tag to get a second review from someone else.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Sorry for the slow reply, thanks for taking over!

Thanks!

bors r+

If you think it's useful, you could also add the more general
```lean
theorem Filter.eventually_comap' {f : β → α} (F : Filter α) (P : α → Prop) :
    (∀ᶠ x : β in comap f F, P (f x)) ↔ ∀ᶠ x in F ⊓ 𝓟 (range f), P x := by
  rw [← eventually_map, map_comap]
```
and deduce your version from it.

If you think it's useful, you could also add the more general
```lean
theorem Filter.eventually_comap' {f : β → α} (F : Filter α) (P : α → Prop) :
    (∀ᶠ x : β in comap f F, P (f x)) ↔ ∀ᶠ x in F ⊓ 𝓟 (range f), P x := by
  rw [← eventually_map, map_comap]
```
and deduce your version from it.

Thanks!

bors r+

```suggestion
  rw [← eventually_map, nhds_induced, nhdsWithin, map_comap_setCoe_val]
```
